artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Sasaki Toyokichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 509.7; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 276.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: standing woman with elaborate ornaments in her hair, wearing a lavender kimono with brown and white flowers and light blue belt, with red underneath; shaded grey ground with falling cherry blossom petals
markings: Artist’s seal: 大蘇 {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: ホリ勇 {hori Yū}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Collection of Thirty-six Ghosts in New Style (Shinkei sanjūrokkaisen 新形三十六怪撰)
title: Spirit of the Komachi Cherry Tree
